poem:
Title: "The Ex-Pledge"

In the wake of green dreams sown,  
a ghost ship drifts, pledge overthrown.  
Idle winds blow through empty sails,  
echoes of promised winds that fail.  

What transpired this regrettable switch,  
from verdant valleys to barren ditch?  
A once bright refrain, now turned raven,  
lamenting the loss of Earth's haven.  

The Norwegian Blue sighs, "the course is set,"  
a pledge denied, a sun's regret.
